content.body: One "fun" thing that the proxy target doesn't enforce is that keys are in the same order. So you can have a frozen object but the key order changes over time ðŸ«¢
content.formatted_body: One "fun" thing that the proxy target doesn't enforce is that keys are in the same order. So you can have a frozen object but the key order changes over time ðŸ«¢

content.body:
> <@aclaymore:matrix.org> One "fun" thing that the proxy target doesn't enforce is that keys are in the same order. So you can have a frozen object but the key order changes over time ðŸ«¢

I know, and I hate it. I've been on the edge of writing a proposal to lock that down for a couple of years.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @aclaymore:matrix.org
One "fun" thing that the proxy target doesn't enforce is that keys are in the same order. So you can have a frozen object but the key order changes over time ðŸ«¢
I know, and I hate it. I've been on the edge of writing a proposal to lock that down for a couple of years.
